Project Portfolio

The following are examples of projects spanning my last 8 years of web development.

Due to the nature of some of the work, the actual sites are no accessible on the internet. The designs represent the nature of the project to provide some indication of the types of application I have experience working with and creating.

Cyber Essentials

(3 months)

A jekyll based website to be edited via a CMS for the Cyber Essentials government team.

Jekyll Docker AWS HTML / CSS PHP Siteleaf Markdown

Cyber First (2018 Competition)

(3 months)

A jekyll based website to be edited via a CMS for the New talent government team who run the annual Cyber First girls competition.

Jekyll Docker AWS HTML / CSS PHP Siteleaf

NCSC

(8 months)

Provided living style guide for developers to build the actual site from and supported the integration of the markup into the actual site build.

HTML / CSS Javascript SASS AWS

(3 months)

An Operating system for secure environments with bespoke web based UI.

Workflow Application

(3 months)

Document Workflow UI to manage assets and permissions and provide visible feedback when others have updaed content.

AngularJS HTML / CSS3

Various Components

(8 months)

Various components to be integrated into multiple larger applications. One was to provided a notifications button and dropdown list, the other was a form to provide justification for an action.

ReactJS HTML / CSS3

IntelReveal

(3 weeks)

A rapid build prototype for a UI to allow searching for data, mapping data and visually displaying links between data on graphs and maps.

HTML / CSS AngularJs HighCharts

CommsReveal

(4 months)

A analytics tool to map and visualise current data and provide preditions for future data trends based on changing factors.

HTML / CSS AngularJs HighCharts

Symantec.Cloud

(4 Years)

Fully managing the primary website for Symantec.Cloud. The project went through 3 facelifts over a 4 year period. The site was build on a bespoke CMS written in C# which was developed and extended by myself to meet the requirements of the marketing team.
